attributes.action: Ensure David cameron, if invited, takes part in any TV debate with Nigel Farage.
attributes.additional_details:
David Cameron believes he has information that will convince the British public that we should stay in the EU.

Nigel Farage has been in and fought against the EU for around 20 years and is well versed in the mechanics of the EU.

These two should put their case in a televised debate, should the TV companies offer one.
attributes.background: The public are asking for information on the EU Referendum. David Cameron heads the IN Campaign, Nigel Farage is an expert on the EU on the OUT side.  A televised debate should take place before the referendum, and Mr Cameron should take part if invited by any broadcaster.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. This would be a personal decision for the Prime Minister, and not the responsibility of the UK Government and Parliament as a whole.
